utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: In the wake of the London terror attack, President Trump is renewing his call for a travel ban. Which its currently on hold when the Supreme Court decides if they will hear the case. That didn't sit well with CNN host Reza Aslan who responds it on Twitter, quote, "This piece of -- is not just an embarrassment to America and a stain on the presidency. He's an embarrassment to humankind." Aslan later deleted the tweet and apologize for his use of profanity. Well, things weren't any better over on MSNBC with one host suggesting President Trump actually wants a terror attack to happen on U.S. soil.

utterances.speaker: THOMAS ROBERTS, MSNBC HOST
utterances.sentences: The president doesn't want us to be politically correct. Right? So let's not be pc about this. Is the President trying to provoke a domestic terrorist attack with this twitter rant? Because only to prove himself right? It seems like the President is trying to provoke something that he can politicize more for his own gain in America. Do you feel that way?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, I think Mr. Roberts is a victim of projection. It's the Left that often uses tragedy for political means. So, if there's global warming, they go, oh my God, they want global warming to happen to prove that they were right about coal, when there's mass shootings, they immediately go, see, see, guns, guns, guns. We see lots of that. I don't see that much on the right. And about Reza, you know, he apologized as he never swears. He swears all the time.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He also explores the fringes of religion on a show and religions that embrace death. Ultra-Orthodox. His doomed day cults, cannibal sex.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But he avoids focusing on the toxic elements of his own faith. It is the most biased show you could ever watch. And I mean, he's never gone after -- I've looked at his show. I haven't seen anything but he goes after everybody from scientology to other unusual religions but he never touches --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Islam?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, he won't go after it critically.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: So, lying Aslan. Okay, Dana --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Nicely done.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I would say that, I find that Twitter and also cable news in particular -- like everybody gets a choice of what they are going to say. And if you want to be provocative and you want to like delete a tweet and say you're sorry, you can do that. But you can also be adults and one of the things that they complain about with President Trump was his NATO presence, so he was there two weeks ago. He didn't say article five which, okay, I agree, he should have said it. Right? And apparently his national security team thought that he was going to and he didn't. Fine. But at this point, why don't you say President Trump, we'll stand with you that NATO needs to do more to fight terrorism. Like the message to these people's madness is that they are driving themselves crazy because of President Trump rather than trying to focus on the fact that what they really want -- that the goal is to try to fight terrorism together to help save western civilization from these radical Islamic terrorists. And instead they don't. They are tweeting comedy on Twitter. Like think about what you are saying before you say it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I wouldn't have a job if I did that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: We like you just fine, Greg. Okay, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I just want to quickly pick up on something Greg just said. You know, this guy, Aslan or whoever his name is, he does not like me to respond in a derogatory fashion. A month ago, he called Trump a piece of blank. He called Dinesh D'Souza, he said, go f-yourself. He said of Corey Lewandowski, you are an a-hole. And then he wished Congressman Todd Akin was raped. So, this guy has a long track of --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Tomorrow he'll have a long press conference with Lisa Bloom.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's exactly right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So, I think, you know, the crazier the left is becoming, I think it shows how effective President Trump is being. He has had a beheading situation, you have Chelsea Handler saying crazy stuff. You have this guy, all this goofy stuff over at MSNBC. The left is coming on glued. I think that is the story. And President Trump is doing it to them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What happened to --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He's driving a stake right between the heart of the left and he's peeling the fringe left out this way. Because now Franken has to distance himself from people like Kathy Griffin but he's also driving a real wedge between the mainstream media and the American public. Because they are getting so loopy and they're getting so crazy and they're losing all credibility that the public is just tuning them out.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't think the public is tuning them out.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Look at their credibility in the polling.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'm just telling you, the ratings -- and I think this is true across liberal or conservative outlets. The ratings are whips. I don't think they're tuning them out. The thing that strikes me is --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Tuning out the credibility.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- you don't like it when Donald Trump, our president, says things that are provocative, insightful, rude, even offensive. Deeply offensive to people and if someone strikes back and you say, oh, why did you say that? Why did you use language comparable to what Trump is using? He's the president. He should be a leader. He should be a moral leader as well as a political leader but he is not.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Trump, how many times have I gone after Trump more than anybody's network?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, come on, you know what, I mean, you said the left --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Only. But you don't remember last year?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You don't remember last year?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes. But you said the left uses this, who on the right uses the flag like a symbol? Huh? Who on the right uses terror attacks to say let's shut downs and let's propose a Muslim ban --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Kathy Griffin --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Wait. Wait. Wait. I don't understand. Why are you not allowed to embrace the U.S. flag?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, I said to use the U.S. flag like if they're private symbol and it's not a symbol of our --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God, it belongs to everybody, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, sure it does.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: So ridiculous!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Which is why I say, why all of a sudden does the right --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh my God!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But I think the bigger point to me is, you know what, it seems to me that you have a lot of people in this press who decided they are going to engage with Donald Trump on his turf, on his terms. And I do think that's not good.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: So, with these people did here, I assume you denounce it? That it is inappropriate --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think it's inappropriate to speak, I don't speak that way in general. But I must say, Donald Trump's behavior and actions, Kimberly, invite this kind of response.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So, he invited his head to be beheaded.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'm talking about --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Juan, can I add that this kind of response has been involved in progressive humor for edgy alternative comedy forever. This is not new. They would demonize Romney, they would demonize Bush, Reagan, Reagan was Hitler for the longest time. He exists the way before Trump. Trust me, I'm old.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes. No, no, no, I am older than you, buddy. But I'm just telling you --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What strikes me is, oh, he has everything to say about this latest terror attack. What about Portland? What about Kansas?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He mentioned Portland.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He did mention Portland.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: He mentioned it like a week later when people shamed him.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He wants to get the job done. You are objecting to his rhetoric but nevertheless he was trying to fulfill his campaign promises. He was elected. He is the President of the United States. His supporters still stand by him. So, I suggest perhaps you do not vote for him for reelection. Directly ahead, more wild claims from Al Gore about climate change. You won't believe this. Details in a battle, up next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: President Trump last week outraged environmentalists by withdrawing the United States from the Paris Climate Accord. And former Vice President Al Gore is so upset that he has taken to citing the bible.

utterances.speaker: AL GORE, FORMER VICE PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: We still are not changing fast enough because -- it's not just the scientific in community warning us now. It's Mother Nature. Every night on the TV news is like a nature hike through the Book of Revelations.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Mr. Gore also appeared on "Fox News Sunday" where Chris Wallace challenged him on one of his more controversial claims.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS WALLACE, HOST
utterances.sentences: After your movie "An Inconvenient Truth" came out in 2006, you made the following comments, unless we took "drastic measures," the world would reach a point of no return within 10 years and you call that a true planetary emergency. We're 11 years later, weren't you wrong?

utterances.speaker: GORE
utterances.sentences: Well, we have seen a decline in emissions for the first -- on a global basis, for the first time they've stabilized and started to decline so some of the responses of the last ten years have helped. But unfortunately and regrettably, a lot of serious damage has been done.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK. I thought Chris Wallace was very restrained in that interview, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But who was he interviewing? That wasn't Al Gore. That was like Al Gore Jr. The guy has more worked on than the Hoover Dam. His hair looks like a mini wind farm. By the way, what he just said there was, yes, a lot of stuff in my movie wasn't true but some of it was? That's an old psychic's trick. At the end of the year a psychic will give out a thousand predictions knowing that America will only remember one or two that are right. So he was wrong about Mount Kilimanjaro. He said that would be snow free in a decade. He predicted the storms to get worse due to climate change. Even the IPCC called BS on that. He said there would be no arctic by 2013. It's there. There's ice. And by the way, the polar bears are doing great. Imagine if these were a different topic, a different topic and it wasn't climate change and it was terror, and he was lying about terror. The media would be all over him and they wouldn't be calling him up. The fact os, you can lie about climate change because the media's assumptions match those lies so they don't call him on it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Interesting because today NASA -- did you see their tweet today? NASA said that oh, actually maybe it's not as bad as we thought?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, (INAUDIBLE) just walked it back.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's never as bad as they think it is.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Especially Al.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Especially Al. I actually like the Al's haircut. I actually think he looks good.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's a wind farm.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, I think I like the haircut. I can appreciate a good haircut.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He's got some volumizing mousse or something.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He looks quite dapper. The guy has made millions being a climate change preacher and he's saying this is where you have to send your money, to the right people. You have to send your money to the right industries. And he's preying on people's guilt and fear and he's doing very well. I'd love a "60 Minutes" expose about how actually green Al Gore lives. I'm not quite sure he lives that green.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He was asked about that. Can we roll that sound bite?

utterances.speaker: JAKE TAPPER, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: President Trump has gone after you directly when talking about this issue of climate change. This is a criticism we hear from conservatives all the time when talking about people like you or Elon Musk or Leonardo DiCaprio, that you yourself have a large carbon footprint.

utterances.speaker: GORE
utterances.sentences: Yes, well, I don't have a private jet. What carbon emissions come from, my trips on Southwest Airline are offset. I live a carbon free lifestyle to the maximum extent.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Listen, I will ask you your own question --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I mean, come on. He is saying he doesn't own his own private jet.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But he borrows them to fly to his --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Let's be honest, you know, he flies private. Has he been on commercial?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Have you seen the size of his house? He has two houses, right. They're huge.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He's not hurting, OK? To the extent possible, he lives a carbon free life, OK, whatever. The problem I have with him, I don't care. He can fly private and do whatever he wants, but I'm sorry, your predictions were way off.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And he's telling you how to live.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Way off and I'm still wondering if he really did create the internet.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Juan, did Al Gore bear any sort of responsibility for alarmism that makes actually people question the science or question the outcome --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Good question.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh no. That is too -- talk about inconvenient truth here. Al Gore I think you could say legitimately, Dana, has engaged in hyperbole. That he says that we all might die. He's trying to like, you know, make you think that the sky is falling at times. I would say yes, that's right. Now, we don't say that about somebody else who tweets every morning, do we? We don't say, oh no, way terrible hyperbole, excessive, offensive at times. But I will say this --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That people are dying from terrorism. No one is dying from climate change.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh no, I think that in fact, we see coastal waters rising. In fact, the Pentagon is saying it maybe that this causes war and instability in our nations -- in the world.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why isn't there weren't so in California with the drought? They say the drought caused in Syria. There has been a drought in California forever. Where are the ices cults in California?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So the fact that we are having droughts, the fact that we have terrible rainstorms, the fact that we've had -- I think it's five or six years in a row of the highest temperatures ever, this doesn't --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Margin of error, Juan. You know the facts.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Margin of error is --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Our audience has a memory from the last show.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You need some facts, that's what you need.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You need some drugs.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think we can do an entire show on climate change and we'll watch Juan's temperature rise. When we return, even some prominent voices on the left are saying the Democrats are going way too far with all the Russia- Trump talk. That report, when we come right back.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There are a few subjects Democrats love to discuss more than possible collusion between Russia and the Trump campaign. One prominent liberal editor now thinks the left has gone too far.

utterances.speaker: KATRINA VANDEN HEUVEL, EDITOR AND PUBLISHER, THE NATION
utterances.sentences: I think Democrats are making a mistake going in Russia, Russia, Russia, all the time. I think Democrats have to have a bold, inclusive populist agenda. Get it out into the country, fight on health care, fight on jobs, fight on a different engagement with the world. Don't let this overtake it. And I think that that is about a party that needs to be one of proposition, not simply opposition resistance is not enough.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: She might be on to something because the head Democrat on the Senate Intel Community says he's yet to see any damning evidence.

utterances.speaker: SEN. MARK WARNER, D-VA.
utterances.sentences: We have no smoking gun at this point but there is a lot of smoke. And what I hope our committee is able to do and we've -- very proud of the fact that it's maintained its bipartisan approaches. We're going to just follow the facts.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, can the Democrats run a midterm election strategy on a Russia conspiracy theory?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, I think it'd be a loser. I mean they could do it but it'd be a loser, right. Now, what is interesting is a lot of talk that in fact what they want to do is something you suggested earlier, Jesse, run against the media. But the problem for the Republicans, they can run against the media, they trash the Democratic candidates as too liberal or whatever, but then the Democrats open the door. Democrats are saying you've got the White House, you've got the House of Representatives and the Senate and what happened to tax reform? What happened to repeal and replace? What happened to infrastructure? It's supposed to be a big deal this week. I don't see it coming now. Again, this is the problem. I think that's the smart way for Democrats to run against the party of Trump.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's right. Kimberly, if I hear Russia one more time, I mean, I can't believe it. Isn't the country sick of hearing about it? I see people in the street, they're fed up with it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, I mean, it doesn't seem to be playing well for a large part of obviously the electorate and people that support, you know, President Trump. There is the obstructionists and people who want to try to find anything to slow him down from being able to implement his policies and his agenda, that he was voted into office to achieve. So, for me, so far, where's the evidence of any of this? There's a lot of big headlines and buzzwords thrown around about collusion, you know, where is this? There's no evidence to suggest that there was anything improper or illegal done between the Trump campaign and anybody -- foreign agents -- in Russia. So, the problem for them is, when this is in fact put to bed and to rest, hopefully soon, then what are they going to say?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What will the Democrat say, Dana, if some of these investigations come back and --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, just like -- let's say the investigations don't come back empty-handed -- what will a lot of people on the right say? They'll say its baloney. The people on the left, even if it comes back and they say that there is nothing, the left will say, oh, there was something and it was hidden. There will be conspiracies on either side.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But I do agree with Katrina Vanden Huevel that the Democrats --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Have you ever said that before?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, I've never said that before.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That's an excellent --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: She is right. And that they are seeding (ph) a lot of policy ground. I talked to someone on the Senate today who said that they can expect to the six weeks a health care vote in the Senate. That they are going to advance tax reform. That they are going to try to move on infrastructure and they'll also be probably Iran sanctions and you know that the debt ceiling vote is coming up. All of those are very serious policy grounds and if we're only talking about Russia and you're not making your point as to what you are for in those arenas, you're actually seeing all of that grounds to Republicans and they will pass something and then you'll be left holding the Russian bag.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I said this before but I think it's such a good point that I'm going to say it again -- 30-40 years ago, the left had no interest in the USSR. They felt the Cold War was a joke. They were hyper focused on American evil. Now it's 2017 and they are finally caught up. They're focusing on Russia while the world and the new threat is not Russia, its Islamism. It's Islamism. So maybe in 2057, they will finally catch up and go, wow, what about this radical Islam thing I'm hearing about? And we will all be wearing burqas.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You think Islam will be defeated that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Do you think Islam is as big a threat as Russia?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, about 10 times as big.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh my gosh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's an ideology that wants to destroy us. Russia does not want to destroy us. The ideology -- the apocalyptic ideology wants us all dead because the way they interpret their religion is that heaven requires them killing all of us.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think Russia wants to absolutely push us off the world stage and make themselves the dominant --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Juan, that's be competitive but they're not a party --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Like I said --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Who said this, "the '80s called, they want their foreign policy." It's almost impossible to get in trouble for anything on HBO unless your name is Bill Maher. We'll tell you why the comedian is in hot water, up next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Comedian Bill Maher has made a career out of pushing the boundaries. On Friday, he went, well, I think too far while interviewing Nebraska senator Ben Sasse.

utterances.speaker: SEN. BEN SASSE, R-NEB.
utterances.sentences: We would love to have you work in the field with us.

utterances.speaker: BILL MAHER, HOST
utterances.sentences: Work in the fields?

utterances.speaker: SASSE
utterances.sentences: That's part --

utterances.speaker: MAHER
utterances.sentences: Senator, I'm a house (BLEEP).

utterances.speaker: MAHER
utterances.sentences: It's a joke.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: In a statement, HBO called the comment "completely inexcusable and tasteless." And Maher apologized for using the racial slur. What do you think Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, I'm sure he's sorry, but the dirtiest secret of white liberals is that they assume they're exempt from these kinds of controversies because they've already embraced the liberal platitude. They have a get out of bigot jail card. Shelby Steele's book, he talks about how a white friend who made a racist joke in front of him because he assumed that Shelby was a black prop. Here is my black friend, therefore I can use the N-word or say something. And I think Bill Maher has, you know, talked enough on equality and about being a progressive that he feels he has carte blanche. That he can make these jokes. But the fact is, the joke is real -- the what such things as house, you know. He was making a joke about some kind of suffering.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, the thing I don't get, K.G., is you know, we hear all these complaints about Bill Maher. Why not about these black rappers who use these words to excess and it seems to me are equally degrading.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, you're saying there's a double standard --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I don't like it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No, no, but if the word is an appropriate use and it is, it should not be used by anybody. I agree. And I think what Bill Maher did is absolutely reprehensible. I'm shocked even to somebody like himself would do and say something like that. I don't know. If he thinks that he's above it and isn't going to be, you know, held accountable, that's really sad.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I agree. Jesse, what do you make of the fact that this comes on the heels of Kathy Griffin and it just seems like the provocateurs are running wild.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I don't think it's the provocateurs. I think the left and the media, they are ones who have become the deplorable they warned everybody else against. And when it comes to offensive speech, it seems like liberals don't really care what is said, it only matters who says it because if a conservative talks or says anything close to this, they would be off the air in a second. He's not really paying a price for this. I guess if you are Bill Maher, you are allowed to say that word on HBO and not get in trouble for it. That's just plain shocking --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, and I also haven't seen a lot of other people stand up and really condemn him that strongly. They did with Kathy Griffin, you know, I respect that. I didn't hear anything about Bill Maher.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: In fact, Dana, Al Franken, the senator from Minnesota says he's not going to appear -- he was supposed to appear this coming Friday on the Bill Maher's show.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, just imagine if you're Al Franken and basically you're carrying a liberal torch and you have a book out that's gotten all these great reviews and within five days, you have to cancel your event with Kathy Griffin and your appearance on the Maher show, which is hurting your book tour. I mean, basically it's like liberal cannibalism.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh my god.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That must taste really bad.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Hey, hey, "One More Thing" up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Very good.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Time for "One More Thing." Let's do this. "Greg's Guy News." We need some guy news. This is the true measure of a man. Take a look at this photo. This was taken on Friday. This is Theunis Wessels, if you can see him, he's mowing his lawn as a tornado approaches. This is a small town in Canada in Alberta. His wife was watching him and thought he's interesting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Don't you notice there is a tornado? And he said, yes, I'm aware of it. I've watched a lot of TV about them and I am monitoring it. This is how you measure your manliness. I go inside.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Or your marriage.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I go inside when I see a bee. There's a bee, I'm inside.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Which is why I was thinking maybe that should have been like, Jesse's?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's called irony, Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, I know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There you got.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: This is so clever and manly.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, as you guys know, my kids think I am the least hip person in America.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So do I.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So this weekend -- thank you Jesse -- so this weekend, I was introduced to this song and I want Greg to tell me about it. Go ahead, play the music.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It's "Despacito" Gregory.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's the number one song in the USA and it had been that for four weeks now. First Spanish song to hit number one in the U.S. since the "Macarena" in '96 and the only one --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's no "Macarena."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, and the only one before that was "La Bamba" if you remember "La Bamba."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: When the "Macarena" comes on at a wedding, things go crazy, clothes comes off.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, that's the thing because this song by Luis Fonsi and Daddy Yankee and Justin Bieber -- Beiber sings both English and Spanish. But guess what? I think something is changing when you have this at number one. I mean --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What about Louie (ph), what's his name, Bega? Remember Mambo whatever? That was a hell of a song. I don't care. Oh wait, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK, my turn. I listened to some music last night to the Dierks Bentley concert in Jersey.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And what a surprise.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It was a great way to start the summer, but I had a chance to hang out with them just a little bit. It's a great show if you have a chance, it's like full of heart, patriotism, lots of fun. And he was the surprise national anthem singer tonight at the Predators game, the NHL game. That's hockey for those of you who don't know who the Predators are, showing up even though he's been under the weather with a little bit of a cold.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Is he freaked out by you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, I'm like kind of embarrassed. I have a little bit of --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You guys are best friends --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh boy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- grateful dead of Dierks Bentley.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I think you guys are best friends now or something like that. Kind of cute. It bloomed. All right, so, it was a concert that brought so much hope and healing to a country that has been torn apart by terror. Ariana Grande returning to the U.K. to headline "One Love Manchester." I'm sure many of you saw different clips of it. Take a listen to this.

utterances.speaker: ARIANA GRANDE, SINGER
utterances.sentences: I love you guys so much. I think the kind of love and unity that you are displaying is the medicine to the world we need -- really need right now. I want to thank you for being just that. And I want to thank you for coming tonight. I love you so much.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: A powerful role model to young women, Ariana Grande, to do that and go forth. So this event raised more than $13 (ph) million for victims of the attack. They were there two weeks ago -- 22, remember, killed and dozens hurt and Greg has been like a little (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They've raised a lot of money. They've raised like what, $14, $15 million?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: -- Katy Perry and Miley Cyrus, Justin Bieber.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That would make you a "Belieber."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No it won't, but I admire the fact that they raised money for this. It's very good.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All of it to Manchester and the London terror attack victims.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK, while Greg Gutfeld was doing his monologue, I was playing golf today. So, I hit the links to raise some money for the Planting Fields Foundation at the golf classic at Mill River Club. That was my caddy, Al De Blasio on the right. I never lost a ball and he gave me some great reads and then that's Steve (INAUDIBLE) over there on the left. Another great patriot there. We had a lot fun today.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And also what was the big news today for you at golf?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I did not cheat. Still didn't break 90.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, Trump was golfing on a weekend while terrible things -- I'm glad you went golfing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Set your DVR and never miss an episode of "The Five." "Hannity" is next. Watch it! Content and Programming Copyright 2017 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
